title: Fact Check: Old video of a landslide shared as a recent incident in Goa | Newsmobile
author: newsmobile.in
vclaim:
A video is widely being shared on the internet which shows a massive landslide. It is being claimed that the video was taken in Goa, India.

The caption of the video read: “Goa madgaon highway : Live scene of land slide ….”

NewsMobile fact-checked the above claim and found it to be fake.

On extracting the keyframes and putting it through Reverse Image Search, we found that the incident was reported by a local Indonesian media house on April 10, 2020. The title of the video read, ‘100-meter high cliffs in Cianjur Avalanche’. (Translated from Indonesian)

‘100 meters high cliff in Cianjur, West Java landslides on Thursday (09/04/2020) covering the entire road. As a result, access to dozens of subdistricts in South Cianjur was totally paralyzed,’ description read. (Translated from Indonesian)

We debunked the same video earlier when it was circulated as being from Shillong, Meghalaya in India.

Hence, the above information proves that the landslide took place in Indonesia and not in Goa.
